attributes.action: If all public gatherings are not advised, What about supermarkets?
attributes.additional_details:
Because nothing has been said about supermarkets as much, even though it’s a high risk place because everyone is panic buying!

Staff are overworked.

Staff are more at high risk.

We don’t get a chance to clean as much as we use to.

Their is close contact when working self service & scan as you shop.
attributes.background: To help reduce customers in stores if it’s not right for mass gatherings then why are stores allowed to be packed out? & staff become overworked & more at risk?

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the risks of supermarkets remaining open during the coronavirus outbreak, but it's not clear if you want the Government to require supermarkets to close, or to take some other action to reduce the risks to customers and staff.

You could start a new petition stating more clearly what you want the Government to do.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
